body_html:
tf.keras.Model.fit does not support distributed yet, if that is what you're asking.
However, you can convert a Keras model to an Estimator using tf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator and use that for distributed training.

See also: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/estimator/train_and_evaluate and https://cloud.google.com/blog/big-data/2018/02/easy-distributed-training-with-tensorflow-using-tfestimatortrain-and-evaluate-on-cloud-ml-engine

Hope that helps.
body_text:
tf.keras.Model.fit does not support distributed yet, if that is what you're asking.
However, you can convert a Keras model to an Estimator using tf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator and use that for distributed training.
See also: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/estimator/train_and_evaluate and https://cloud.google.com/blog/big-data/2018/02/easy-distributed-training-with-tensorflow-using-tfestimatortrain-and-evaluate-on-cloud-ml-engine
Hope that helps.
body:
`tf.keras.Model.fit` does not support distributed yet, if that is what you're asking.
However, you can convert a Keras model to an `Estimator` using [`tf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator`](https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/estimators#creating_estimators_from_keras_models) and use that for distributed training.

See also: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/estimator/train_and_evaluate and https://cloud.google.com/blog/big-data/2018/02/easy-distributed-training-with-tensorflow-using-tfestimatortrain-and-evaluate-on-cloud-ml-engine

Hope that helps.
